binpack

Simple 2D bin packing implementation for Lua.

Packs different-sized rectangles into a rectangular container. This implementation solves the online bin packing problem where rectangles are inserted one at a time in random order.

Functions
binpack.​newContainer

Create a new bin packing container.

Parameters
width

The width of the container

height

The height of the container

padding

(optional) The amount of padding inside each container cell (defaults to 0)

mode

(optional) Determines if the container's size is dynamic or static.  A dynamically sized container will grow if a rectangle does not fit into it.  Pass "static" as the value to create a static-sized container (defaults to "dynamic")

Returns

Container object

Raise

Invalid value for mode

Example

Create a dynamically sized container:

local container = binpack.newContainer(256, 256)

Create a static-sized container:

local staticContainer = binpack.newContainer(32, 32, 0, "static")
